clause.title: 6.3.POI Class Model
clause.p: The following classes form the core of the POI model. These classes are the same for all POIs.

li.p: AbstractPOI: The abstract model for a Point of Interest. All POI instances will contain these attributes.
FeatureOfInterest: This is an OGC Feature which has been defined independently from the POI. Conceptually, the purpose of the POI is to provide a user friendly synopsis of this Feature.

td.p: An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL be an accurate representation of the UML model for that class.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi-feature-with-lifespan.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi-contactinfo.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi-featureofinterest.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi-metadata.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi-keywords.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi-rights.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi-symbology.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi-haspayload.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with the following criteria:
An encoding of the Abstract POI class SHALL include one or more contactInfo attributes.
Encodings of the contactInfo attribute SHALL be a valid implementation of the CI_Responsibility class from ISO 19115-1:2014

th.p: Requirement 15: Requirement — POI Feature of Interest

td.p: An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with the following criteria:
An encoding of the Abstract POI class SHALL include zero or more associated instances of the FeatureOfInterest class.
The target of the hasFeatureOfInterest aggregation SHALL be a valid implementation of the Feature class from ISO 19109:2015
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with the following criteria:
An encoding of the Abstract POI class SHALL include zero or more metadata attributes.
An implementation of the metadata association SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/link.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with the following criteria:
An encoding of the Abstract POI class SHALL include zero or more keywords attributes.
Encodings of the keywords attribute SHALL be a valid implementation of the MD_Keywords class from ISO 19115-1:2014.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with the following criteria:
An encoding of the Abstract POI class SHALL include zero, one, or two rights attributes.
Encodings of the rights attribute SHALL be a valid implementation of the MD_Constraints class from ISO 19115-1:2014.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with the following criteria:
An encoding of the Abstract POI class SHALL include zero or one symbology attributes.
Encodings of a symbology attribute SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/link.
An instantiation of the Abstract POI class SHALL comply with the following criteria:
An encoding of the Abstract POI class SHALL include zero or more associated instances of the POI_Payload class.
The associated POI_Payload classes SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi-payload.
The encoding of the Link class SHALL be implemented using a hyperlink approach appropriate for implementing technology.
An encoding of the POI class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/req-poi-abstract-poi.

clause.title: 6.4.POI Payload
clause.p: A POI is a representation of a Feature. The POI class provides a standard way to identify and manage a POI. However, it does not provide any information about the Feature it is representing. This information is difficult to standardize since it is dependent on the data model of the Feature store being described.

Therefore, the POI model is designed to be extended with properties specific to a Feature or a Feature Collection. The POI Payload is a container for representations of Feature properties. The syntax of those representations is provided by the Payload Schema class. Where appropriate, semantics can also be provided through the Payload Definition class. Since the schema and definitions may be the same for a large number of Features, these classes should be instantiated as referenceable resources, allowing one instance to be used by a number of POIs.

li.p: POI_Payload: The abstract model for a Point of Interest. All POI instances will contain these attributes.
PayloadSchema: The Payload Schema Class represents a syntactic model (schema) for a POI payload.
PayloadDefinition: The Payload Definition Class represents a semantic model (ontology) for a POI payload.

clause.p: In the interest of interoperability, the POI Payload should be constructed using data types and concepts which are already in wide use by the Geospatial community. A collection of data types and concepts defined by the ISO 19103, ISO 19107, ISO 19109, and ISO 19115 Standards is provided in Annex B.

While the POI Payload should have a single syntactic model (schema), there may be more than one way to represent that model. For example, JSON Schemas are commonly provided using both JSON and YAML encodings. The POI abstract model allows a POI Payload to have multiple usesSchema aggregations in order to support this practice.

The hasDefinition aggregation is provided in anticipation of the future use of ontologies to associate meaning (semantics) with the structure (syntax) of the POI Payload. Use of the hasDefinition aggregation is optional.

td.p: An instantiation of the POI_Payload class SHALL be an accurate representation of the UML model for that class.
An instantiation of the POI_Payload class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi_payload-hasfeatureofinterest.
An instantiation of the POI_Payload class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi_payload-hasdefinition.
An instantiation of the POI_Payload class SHALL comply with requirement /req/core/poi_payload-usesschema.

th.p: Requirement 24: Requirement — POI Payload Has Feature of Interest

td.p: An instantiation of the POI_Payload class SHALL comply with the following criteria:
An encoding of the Abstract POI_Payload class SHALL include zero or more hasFeatureOfInterest aggregations.
The target of a hasFeatureOfInterest aggregation SHALL be a valid implementation of the Feature class from ISO 19109:2015

th.p: Requirement 25: Requirement — POI Payload has definition

td.p: An instantiation of the POI_Payload class SHALL comply with the following criteria:
An encoding of the Abstract POI_Payload class SHALL include no more than one hasDefinition aggregations.
The target of a hasDefinition aggregation SHALL be a valid ontology for the implementing technology

th.p: Requirement 26: Requirement — POI Payload Uses Schema

td.p: An instantiation of the POI_Payload class SHALL comply with the following criteria:
An encoding of the Abstract POI_Payload class SHALL include one or more usesSchema aggregations.
The target of a usesSchema aggregation SHALL be a valid schema for the implementing technology.

clause.title: 6.5.POI Data Dictionary
clause.p: The POI UML model is the normative definition of the POI Conceptual Model. The Data Dictionary tables in this section were software generated from the UML model. As such, this section provides a normative representation of the POI Conceptual Model.

tr.td: AbstractFeature is the abstract superclass of all feature types within the PoI Model.
Provides further information on the feature.
Specifies the unique identifier of the feature that is valid in the instance document within which it occurs.
Specifies the unique identifier of the feature that is valid globally.
Specifies the name of the feature.
AbstractFeatureWithLifespan is the base class for all PoI features. This class allows the optional specification of the real-world and database times for the existence of each feature.
Indicates the date at which a POI feature was added to the containing model.
Indicates the date at which a POI feature was removed from the containing model.
Indicates the date at which a POI feature started to exist in the real world.
Indicates the date at which a POI feature ceased to exist in the real world.

A Point of Interest (POI) is a Feature which provides a concise summary of one or more associated Features. Its purpose is to provide easy access to key information about one or more real-world objects without the need to access or understand the underlying Feature data set.
Indicates a payload associated with this POI.
One or more Features which are represented by this POI.
Contact information for the creators and maintainers of this POI.
An association with zero or more metadata records providing additional information about this POI and/or the associated Features of Interest.
Keywords used to aid in discovery of POIs of interest.
Legal and security constraints applicable to this POI.
A reference to information about rendering this POI.

The thing whose property is being estimated or calculated in the course of an Observation to arrive at a Result, or whose property is being manipulated by an Actuator, or which is being sampled or transformed in an act of Sampling. (SOSA)
The semantic model (ontology) for a POI payload.
A model of the syntax of the POI payload.
An instance of a POI. Implements the AbstractPOI class.
Identifies the abstract POI implemented by this POI
A representation of properties of the FoI which are to be included in the POI.
A reference to the semantic model of this POI payload.
Indicates the Feature of Interest which is being summarized in this payload.
A reference to the schema for this POI payload.

clause.title: 6.5.1.POI Data Types
clause.p: The following data types are used in the POI UML model.

tr.td: CharacterString is a family of datatypes which represent strings of symbols from standard character-sets. The semantics of CharacterString is in accordance with ISO/IEC 11404:2007 clause 10.1.5. (ISO 19103)
An exact integer value, with no fractional part. (ISO 19103)
A link is a typed connection between two resources. This class is based on the Web Linking model defined in IETF RFC 8288.
Supplies the URI to a remote resource (or resource fragment).

The “hreflang” attribute is a hint indicating what the language of the result of dereferencing the link should be. Note that this is only a hint. Multiple hreflang attributes on a single link-value indicate that multiple languages are available from the indicated resource.
A link relation (rel) attribute identifies the semantics (meaning) of a link. The relation type values should come from either the IANA or OGC relation type registries.
The “title” attribute is used to label the destination of a link such that it can be used as a human-readable identifier (e.g., a menu entry).
The “type” attribute is a hint indicating what the media type of the result of dereferencing the link should be. Note that this is only a hint.

annex.title:
Annex B
(informative)
ISO Data Dictionary
annex.p: ISO Technical Committee 211 maintains a harmonized UML model which covers many of their standards. All the TC211 Standards which are relevant to the POI Standard are included. Therefore the full UML model for POI consists of the classes defined in the POI UML model as well as those which referenced from the TC211 Harmonized UML model.

The Data Dictionary tables in this section were software generated from the TC211 Harmonized UML model. As such, this section provides a normative representation of the TC211 classes which are leveraged by the POI Conceptual Model.

Note that some of the properties in the ISO model are not populated. Since the model is normative, the missing information cannot be included in this document until it is first included in the ISO model by TC211.

clause.title: B.1.General Feature Model
clause.p: The following classes are defined in (ISO 19109:2015)

tr.td:
The class AnyFeature is an instance of the «metaclass» FeatureType (ISO 19109). It represents the set of all classes which are feature types.
+ In an implementation this abstract class shall be substituted by a concrete class representing a feature type from an application schema associated with a domain of discourse (ISO 19109, ISO 19101).

feature: abstraction of real world phenomena
NOTE: A feature may occur as a type or an instance. Feature type or feature instance should be used when only one is meant.
This class describes how a feature class shall be constructed in an Application Schema. In accordance with the conformance clause of the standard, instances of this class are instantiated as feature classes in an Application Schema

clause.title: B.2.Geometry
clause.p: The following classes are defined in ISO 19107:2003

tr.td: GM_Object is the root class of the geometric object taxonomy and supports interfaces common to all geographically referenced geometric objects. GM_Object instances are sets of direct positions in a particular coordinate reference system. A GM_Object can be regarded as an infinite set of points that satisfies the set operation interfaces for a set of direct positions, TransfiniteSet<DirectPosition>. Since an infinite collection class cannot be implemented directly, a Boolean test for inclusion shall be provided by the GM_Object interface. This international standard concentrates on vector geometry classes, but future work may use GM_Object as a root class without modification. NOTE As a type, GM_Object does not have a well-defined default state or value representation as a data type. Instantiated subclasses of GM_Object will.
GM_Point is the basic data type for a geometric object consisting of one and only one point.

The attribute “position” shall be the DirectPosition of this GM_Point. GM_Point::position [1] : DirectPosition NOTE In most cases, the state of a GM_Point is fully determined by its position attribute. The only exception to this is if the GM_Point has been subclassed to provide additional non-geometric information such as symbology.

A GM_LineString (Figure 16) consists of sequence of line segments, each having a parameterization like the one for GM_LineSegment (See 6.4.11). The class essentially combines a Sequence<GM_LineSegments> into a single object, with the obvious savings of storage space.

A GM_Polygon (Figure 21) is a surface patch that is defined by a set of boundary curves and an underlying surface to which these curves adhere. The default is that the curves are coplanar, and the polygon uses planar interpolation in its interior.

clause.title: B.3.Citation and responsible party information
clause.p: The following classes are defined in (ISO 19115-1 Edition 1)

tr.td: information required to enable contact with the responsible person and/or organisation
physical and email address at which the organisation or individual may be contacted
supplemental instructions on how or when to contact the individual or organisation
time period (including time zone) when individuals can contact the organisation or individual
on-line information that can be used to contact the individual or organisation
telephone numbers at which the organisation or individual may be contacted
information about the party if the party is an individual
position of the individual in an organisation
information about the party if the party is an organisation
an individual in the named organisation
information about the individual and/or organisation of the party
name of the party (individual or organization)
information about the party and their role
spatial or temporal extent of the role
function performed by the responsible party

clause.title: B.4.Constraint information
clause.p: The following classes are defined in (ISO 19115-1 Edition 1)

tr.td: restrictions on the access and use of a resource or metadata
Spatial and temporal extent of the application of the constraint restrictions
citation/URL for the limitation or constraint, e.g. copyright statement, license agreement, etc
information concerning the parties to whom the resource can or cannot be released
party responsible for the resource constraints
limitation affecting the fitness for use of the resource or metadata. Example, “not to be used for navigation”
restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource or metadata
otherConstraints: only documented if accessConstraints or useConstraints = “otherRestrictions” (Invariant):
If MD_LegalConstraints used then count of (accessConstraints + useConstraints + otherConstraints + useLimitation + releasability ) > 0 (Invariant):
access constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations on obtaining the resource or metadata
other restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource or metadata
constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations or warnings on using the resource or metadata
party to which the release statement applies
handling restrictions imposed on the resource or metadata for national security or similar security concerns
name of the handling restrictions on the resource or metadata
additional information about the restrictions on handling the resource or metadata.
explanation of the application of the legal constraints or other restrictions and legal prerequisites for obtaining and using the resource or metadata

clause.title: B.5.Identification information
clause.p: The following classes are defined in (ISO 19115-1 Edition 1)

tr.td: specification of a class to categorize keywords in a domain-specific vocabulary that has a binding to a formal ontology
character string to label the keyword category in natural language
URI of concept in ontology specified by the ontology attribute; this concept is labeled by the className: CharacterString.

a reference that binds the keyword class to a formal conceptualization of a knowledge domain for use in semantic processing. NOTE: Keywords in the associated MD_Keywords keyword list must be within the scope of this ontology
keywords, their type and reference source NOTE: When the resource described is a service, one instance of MD_Keyword shall refer to the service taxonomy defined in ISO 19119, 8.3)
When the resource described is a service, one instance of MD_Keyword shall refer to the service taxonomy defined in ISO 19119 (Invariant):

association of a MD_Keywords instance with a MD_KeywordClass to provide user-defined categorization of groups of keywords that extend or are orthogonal to the standardized KeywordTypeCodes and are associated with an ontology that allows additional semantic query processing
commonly used word(s) or formalised word(s) or phrase(s) used to describe the subject
name of the formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of keywords
subject matter used to group similar keywords

clause.title: B.6.Name types
clause.p: The following classes are defined in (ISO 19103:2015)

tr.td: Generic Name is the abstract class for all names in a NameSpace. Each instance of a GenericName is either a LocalName or a ScopedName. A LocalName references a local object directly accessible from the NameSpace. A ScopedName is a composite of a LocalName for locating another NameSpace and a GenericName valid in that NameSpace.
A LocalName references a local object directly accessible from the NameSpace.

A MemberName is a LocalName that references either an attribute slot in a record or recordType or an attribute, operation, or association role in an object instance or type description in some form of schema.
The stored value “aName” is the returned value for the “aName()” operation.
The allowable type for this member.

A Name Space is a domain in which “names” given by character strings (possibly under local constrains constraints enforced by the Name Space) can be mapped to objects via a getObejct operation. Examples include objects which form a Name Space for their attributes, operations and associations, or Schemas that form Name Spaces for their included data types or classes. Not all methods for NameSpaces need to be made publicly accessible.

ScopedName is a composite of a LocalName for locating another NameSpace and a GenericName valid in that NameSpace. ScopedName contains a LocalName as head and a GenericName, which might be a LocalName or a ScopedName, as tail.

A TypeName is a LocalName that references either a recordType or object type in some form of schema. The stored value “aName” is the returned value for the “aName()” operation. This is the types name.
The stored value “aName” is the returned value for the “aName()” operation.

clause.p: The following classes are defined in (ISO 19103:2015)
